pageContext.claim: “If you look at what happens with NATO, we've -- we're spending a vast predominance of the money. We're spending money like -- for years; this has gone on for years.”
pageContext.analysis: This is false. NATO spending is generally measured in terms of what member states spend on their own defense. The United States has higher defense expenditures because it has defense interests worldwide, not just in Europe. In terms of direct spending on NATO, the United States pays around 22 percent of the organization's costs and the next biggest contributor is Germany at 15 percent.
